Class GateArmArrayImpl

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.BaseObjectImpl
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.ControllerIoImpl
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.DeviceImpl
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.GateArmArrayImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
SonarObject, ControllerIO, Device, GateArmArray, Storable
public class GateArmArrayImpl extends DeviceImpl implements GateArmArray
A Gate Arm array is a group of gate arms at a single ramp location. All gate arms in an array are always controlled as a group.
Author:
Douglas Lau

    • setOwnerNext

      public void setOwnerNext(User o)
      Set the next state owner. When a user sends a new state to the gate arm array, two attributes must be set: ownerNext and armState. There can be a race between two clients setting these attributes. If ownerNext is non-null when being set, then a race has been detected, meaning two clients are trying to set the state at the same time.
      Specified by:
      setOwnerNext in interface GateArmArray
